intro: Microtropis curranii var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate microtropis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and requires high humidity and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
